item.title: Hosting a Hugo blog on GitHub Pages with Travis CI
item.description: This post describes how to set up a blog using Hugo, an open-source static site generator. The blog is hosted on GitHub Pages, a web hosting service offered by GitHub. The Travis CI continuous integration service is used to deploy changes to the blog. This post is based on Artem Sidorenko’s article Hugo on GitHub Pages with Travis CI. Contents Overview Installing Hugo Setting up the blog repository Setting up the github.
